result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Anthony Jones

records.addlTxt: 1 year

11:34 AM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones in Court.  Attorney Daniel P Repka in Court for Marcus Anthony Jones.  ADA Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CM265, 22CF60, 22TR292, 22TR293, 22TR294.  ADA Walker recites agreement; Defendant pleading to 15CM265, 1 year Probation, $443 costs, $440 restitution joint/several, 1 day credit if revoked.  Defendant pleading to 22CF60, DJOC for one year, notes conditions.  Defendant pleading to 22TR292.  County moving to dismiss 22TR293 & 22TR294.  Atty. Repka confirms agreement and advises Plea Questionnaire just filed.  He does not represent Defendant on 15CM265.  Court questions basis for DJOC, ADA Walker advises.  Atty. Repka reviews Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with Defendant.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads Guilty to 15CM265 & 22CF60.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the Plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights.  Court notes review of rights by Atty. Repka and notes waiver of counsel as to 15CM265.          Court finds Defendant Guilty of 15CM265 and enters conviction.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of 22CF60, entry of conviction deferred pending approval of DJOC.  Defendant pleads Guilty to 22TR292.  Court finds Defendant Guilty.  22TR293 and 22TR294 dismissed.  ADA Walker states position and notes compliance with victim's rights.  Court notes review of VIS in 15CM265.  Atty. Repka states position.  Defendant makes statement.  Court sentences Defendant.  On 22TR292 court orders forfeiture of $175.30, 3 points, one year to pay.  On 15CM265, sentence W/H.  One year Probation.  $443 court costs.  $440 restitution, joint/several ($400 and $40).  Other specific conditions to be set by Agent.   One day credit if revoked from Probation.  On 22CF60 Court approves DJOC for one year and signs.  Defendant to report to Probation today.  Appeal rights given.  Adjourned at 12:15 PM
Return to Sender/No Such Number/Unable to Forward)
Plea hearing on September 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Hearing(s) (7/25/22) Return to Sender. Insufficient Address.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 4:11 pm.

4:30 PM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones appears by phone, Atty Daniel P Repka appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF60 (PH), 15CM265, 22TR292 22TR293 and 22TR294 (STC). DE would like to waive the PH on 22CF60. Court questions and reviews DEs rights. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DEover for further proceedings. All cases to follow.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

Defendant's Notice of Hearing (6/23/22). Return to Sender. Homeless.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

1:07 PM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones appears in Court, Atty Daniel P Repka appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF60, 15CM265, 22TR292, 22TR293 and 22TR294 (STC). Atty Repka states this are moving forward and would like a PH. ADA Walker suggests this be set for a PH. Atty Repka states DE is now in aftercare so he would be available. ADA Walker does not object to a remote appearance if it is a waiver. Atty Repka states it will be a waiver, zoom appearance is approved. Atty Repka to submit a waiver to the Court. Other cases to follow. Court adjourned at 1:12 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Def from PCJ

3:28 PM Defendant Marcus Anthony Jones appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Daniel P Repka appears by phone, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF60, 15CM265, 22TR292, 22TR293 and 22TR294.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/condition NTO, no objection. Court so orders. Court will quash the warrant on 15CM265 and reinstate the bond. On 22TR292, 22TR293 and 22TR294 Atty Repka enters NG pleas and will follow the felony.  Atty Repka may appear by phone for the next hearing. Court confirms address and phone. Court adjourned at 3:38 pm  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
